column5: I like it!  Very nice Chris  After working serious OT the last few weeks, I'm definitely thinking about having a 13' 2pc CTS done up for next season. Fuji YSG guides this time
Ya know Chris, you might just catching on to this rod building thing.... Excellent work as always!

I have a number of blanks here for myself and never seem to find time to work on them.  Well after having this particular blank in my possession for almost a year I finally found time to get working on it the last few days.  It's a 12' CTS rated 6-10 tied in a twist for a baitcast steelhead set up. It's not done yet but I've made progress on the bottom section, finally!  Fuji SiC guides, custom wood by my buddy John Collina and wrapped in candy apple red with silver and red metallics.  The wood still needs to be polished up but it's finally coming together. Hopefully I'll get a chance to test 'er out before things freeze up.
Amazing work as always Chris!
Nice to see you building one for yourself Chris, she should handle the big flows with ease
Nice!! How much do you want for it? If I was going to go back into river fishing, I'd like to do it with a baitcaster.
I'd be cutting a trench in the ice to fire that baby!  Be sure to post a shot of that michigan wrap when shes done.  Noice work!
Looks awesome Chris !!!! Just curious how much does that weigh ?? Must be super light ??
Did yah sign it... "Best fishes Chris, Spiel?
One word      SWEET
Just beautiful Chris, and very well deserved

Sweet lookin stick Chris!  I'm currently searching for a blank to tie a casting float rod on myself...this one has tweaked my interest.  Gotta get the spey conversion done first though, one thing at a time.
Very Nice!
Incredible talent Chris.    Regards,  Sam
WOW! I want one ! I have no use fr it but I still want it , can you make me a MED?H 6'6" Walleye outfit ?
Nicely done Spiel. About time you did something special for yourself. Flawless artistry as always.
Awesome Chris. I know a place where you can break that baby in with a 24" Brookie. Let me know.

Very Nice Chris.  What are you going to do for a reel?  I recently bought a Avid 10.6 #6-10 caster on the advice of others here.  Amazing deal too. Now I'm thinking of a reel.  Spriing is still far away so I have time.  I did look at the new Calcutta.  They are smaller than before.  The 400 is more the size of a older 200, and there is a 300 available. Just an FYI.

Thanks all.   You know what they say Brian, "if you have to ask......" I've been using a baitcaster for steel for a number of years now, love it. Just wanted another option in the arsenal.    Will do Bud.    While it's not finished I did throw everything on the scale (less the thread I'll use) and she comes in at 175 grams.    No Sir, didn't want to diminish it's value.    PM me any time Randy if you want to discuss options.    Some day Dan, hopefully soon.    Thank ya Sir, I do have a Shimano Calcutta 200 TE DC for it.
Yessiree Chris, your definetely a master of your craft.  Very nice work indeed !!
Thanks Lew.
Well done sir and deserved for sure.    Art
Betcha can't catch sheephead with that Look nice under my tree Come to think about, too long for Perch Great work as usual Bud
Nice work Chris About time you think of yourself for a change
This ought to be sweet, like HD said we'd like to see the spiral wrapped guides  ,  Best wishes Chris
I love the touches you make to your craft-work Chris. Every time I pick up the one's you have made for me I think of the work you have put into them. Thank you!

No sheephead where I fish these rods bud.    Thanks Jacques    Thanks Edwin, I'll keep it updated, more guides in finish this morning.    Thank you Bernie, it means a great deal to me to know your happy with your rods.
